title: Food Resources and Community Meal Information
source_title: The Thankful Times! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
CALENDAR 

of 

community 

meals 

and 

TOPPS 

schedule

CALENDAR of community meals and TOPPS schedule

LIST 

of 

all 

Butler 

County 

Food 

Pantries

LIST of all Butler County Food Pantries

Most 

up 

to 

date 

SNAP 

Information

Most up to date SNAP Information

summary:
The Talawanda School District provides several food assistance resources for families:

- **Little Free Pantries** are available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or as needed
- **Backpack Program** provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at elementary buildings (contact building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food Boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours

Additional resources include a **calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule**, a **list of all Butler County food pantries**, and the **most up-to-date SNAP information** (links provided in original document).

For assistance, contact your building's Social Worker:
- **Kramer:** Chelsea Pike (513-273-3511, pikec@talawanda.org)
- **Marshall:** Chrissy Rolfes (513-273-3611, rolfesc@talawanda.org)
- **Bogan:** Emily White (513-273-3403, whitee@talawanda.org)
- **TMS:** Lydia Schrag (513-273-3311, schragl@talawanda.org)
- **THS:** Chris Robertson (513-273-3224, robertsonc@talawanda.org)

title: Talent Show Sign-Ups Now Open
source_title: The Thankful Times! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TALENT 

SHOW 

SIGN-UPS 

ARE 

NOW 

OPEN!!

TALENT SHOW SIGN-UPS ARE NOW OPEN!!

zoom_out_map
            
Think you’ve got talent? Here’s your chance to shine! Students can sign up for the TMS Talent Show in the cafeteria during lunch. Sign-ups will remain open until all spots are filled.Auditions will begin in November in the band room after school, where participants will perform their acts before a panel of three school staff judges. Once auditions are complete, the final lineup of acts will be announced.Practices will be held after school through April, leading up to a full dress rehearsal and the big performance on April 16th at the Talawanda High School Performing Arts Center.Don’t miss your moment to take the stage—sign up today and show us what you’ve got!

summary: **TMS Talent Show sign-ups are open!** Students can register in the cafeteria during lunch until all spots are filled. Auditions begin in November in the band room after school before a panel of three staff judges. Practices run through April, with the final performance on **April 16th at the Talawanda High School Performing Arts Center**.

title: Mental Health Corner: Being Prepared Reduces Stress
source_title: The Thankful Times! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
~ 

COMMUNITY 

INFORMATION 

~

~ COMMUNITY INFORMATION ~

summary:
**Being Prepared & Mental Health Tips:**

- **Clothes preparation:** Lay out each outfit on Sunday for the entire week to reduce morning stress
- **Electronics charging station:** Keep a dedicated charging spot near your desk/backpack so devices don't get forgotten
- **Homework space:** Do homework in a clean, organized spot (not in bed) to maintain focus and avoid distractions
- **Organize papers:** Color coordinate folders for each class and keep one pocket for due homework. Take 15 seconds at the end of class to file papers properly

**Key message:** Not being prepared causes unnecessary stress and anxiety. Preparing today helps you take care of yourself tomorrow and have a stress-free day.

title: TMS Mountain Bike Club Fall Activities
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
 The TMS Mountain Bike Club had a great start to the year as we learned how to change our tires, maintenance tips, and practiced bike corner control and how and when to change gears. If your student would like to join in the spring, be on the lookout for up-and-coming dates.

summary: The **TMS Mountain Bike Club** had a successful start to the year with activities including tire changing, maintenance tips, bike corner control practice, and gear-shifting techniques. Students interested in joining should **watch for upcoming spring session dates**.

source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

CLUB 

FOOD 

DRIVE!

BUILDER'S CLUB FOOD DRIVE!

summary: The Talawanda Middle School Builders Club is collecting food donations to help community members enjoy a holiday meal. **Requested items include:** baking mixes (muffins, brownies, cornbread, cookies), mac and cheese, canned green beans, soup (cream of mushroom, cream of chicken), and crispy onions in a container (for green bean casserole). **Bring donations to the box in the cafeteria by November 5th.** This food drive is TSD approved for distribution.

PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

**PUSH** (Partners for a United Strong Home) provides **grants to low-income homeowners** in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. 

- **Contact:** Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100

- Application available (attached to original item)

BUCK 

DAY 

IS 

COMING!

BRAVE BUCK DAY IS COMING!

The students have been earning Brave Buck's all year and the celebration is coming soon! We are looking for some extra help with some of the supplies needed. If you would like to help out please use this LINK for the Sign Up Genius. Thank you so much for your continued support and help.

Parents and community members can sign up to help through the **Sign Up Genius link** provided in the original announcement.

title: Lost and Found Items at TMS
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
LOST AND FOUND!
The Lost and Found is growing here at TMS. If your student is missing any items please remind them to check out the table in the cafeteria or ask in the office if it is a small item. A CHEVY KEY FOB WAS FOUND IN THE PARKING LOT THIS WEEK. PLEASE CALL THE OFFICE IF YOU HAVE LOST ONE.

summary: The **Lost and Found** at TMS is accumulating items. Students missing belongings should check the **table in the cafeteria** for larger items or ask at the **office** for small items. **A Chevy key fob was found in the parking lot this week** - please call the office if you've lost one.

title: 7th Grade Cincinnati Museum Center Field Trip
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
7th 

Grade 

Field 

Trip, 

TOTAL 

SUCCESS!!

7th Grade Field Trip, TOTAL SUCCESS!!

Last week, TMS seventh graders had the opportunity to visit the Cincinnati Museum Center where groups could choose to visit the Museum of Natural History or the Museum of Science. Students enjoyed interactive exhibits and were able to see lots of cool artifacts! Afterwards, students visited the 5-story domed Omnimax Theater to watch a film entitled "Deep Sky". Thank you to TMS PTG for helping make this field trip possible! The students had a great time!

summary: TMS seventh graders visited the **Cincinnati Museum Center** last week, choosing between the Museum of Natural History or Museum of Science. Students explored interactive exhibits and artifacts, then watched the film **"Deep Sky"** in the 5-story domed Omnimax Theater. Thanks to TMS PTG for supporting this successful trip!

title: TMS PTG Pie & Butter Braid Fundraiser
source_title: Wickedly Good Updates! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TMS 

PTG 

PIE 

& 

BUTTER 

BRAID 

SALE!!

TMS PTG PIE & BUTTER BRAID SALE!!

OCTOBER 15TH - NOVEMBER 7TH
Each year TMS PTG offers 2 fundraisers. A pie sale in the fall and a cookie dough sale in early spring. The fundraisers are set up so that students have the opportunity to earn money to help pay the cost of class trips offered in the 6th and 8th grade. Every student is welcome to participate and your decision to participate is strictly voluntary. Every student that chooses to participate in a sale will have an account created where their profit will be kept until needed to help pay for a class trip. Please use this LINK for more information on how you can participate.

summary: The **TMS PTG Pie & Butter Braid Sale** runs from **October 15th - November 7th**. This is one of two annual fundraisers (pie sale in fall, cookie dough in spring) where students can earn money toward 6th and 8th grade class trips. Participation is voluntary, and profits are kept in individual student accounts until needed for trip expenses. Visit the provided **[LINK](https://www.talawanda.org/o/tms/article/709641)** for more information on how to participate.

title: TMS Fall Festival 2-Liter Donation Request
source_title: Wickedly Good Updates! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
Donation Request: 2 Liters, Please!
The TMS Fall Festival is coming up on October 24. This is a fun, after school event planned by the Student Council. To help support 6th grade activities throughout the year, we will be hosting a "Pop Toss" game. If you are able, please consider donating 2-Liters (any flavor or variety!). Donations can be sent to school with your student and given to myself or a science teacher. Thank you in advance for your help!

summary: The **TMS Fall Festival** is scheduled for **October 24** as an after-school event organized by Student Council. Families are asked to **donate 2-liter bottles** (any flavor or variety) to support the "Pop Toss" game, which will raise funds for 6th grade activities throughout the year. Donations can be sent to school with students and given to the requester or any science teacher.

21ST

NO HELP SESSIONS ON TUESDAY, OCTOBER 21ST OR THURSDAY, OCTOBER 23RD!!

summary:
**Help sessions are cancelled on Tuesday, October 21st and Thursday, October 23rd.** 

These sessions normally occur on Tuesdays and Thursdays after school to help students complete missed assignments. Students who miss assignments during the week receive a "green slip" on Friday listing incomplete work and are automatically scheduled for the following week's help session, with parents receiving email notification.

title: ADHD Research Study for 5th Graders
source_title: Spooktacular Updates! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: The Cincinnati Children’s RISE: Resilience In Student Education project is offering an important research opportunity focused on understanding and promoting resilience among 5th grade students with ADHD or who experience difficulties with paying attention or hyperactive/impulsive behaviors. Caregivers and students can receive up to $320 for completing questionnaires about academics, organization skills, and social-emotional well-being. Complete our interest form: https://redcap.link/RISEstudy. Contact RISE at RISEstudy@cchmc.org, call 513-803-6321, or visit: studentresilience.orgLINK to Flyer

summary:
Cincinnati Children's **RISE (Resilience In Student Education)** project is recruiting 5th grade students with ADHD or attention/hyperactivity difficulties for a research study on resilience. Caregivers and students can **earn up to $320** for completing questionnaires about academics, organization skills, and social-emotional well-being. 

**Contact:** Complete [interest form](https://redcap.link/RISEstudy), email RISEstudy@cchmc.org, call 513-803-6321, or visit studentresilience.org

title: Community Foundation Supports Project Reboot Program
source_title: Spooky season is here!! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: A special thank you to the Oxford Community Foundation, and DRS Smith Advised Fund for supporting the Project Reboot Assemblies Program in the amount of $4000. The district, the curriculum team, and our secondary schools are very grateful for the support!

summary: The **Oxford Community Foundation** and **DRS Smith Advised Fund** donated **$4,000** to support the **Project Reboot Assemblies Program** at Talawanda schools. The district, curriculum team, and secondary schools express gratitude for this generous support.

title: Ride & Dine with BCRTA Community Event
source_title: Spooky season is here!! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
~ 

COMMUNITY 

INFORMATION 

~

~ COMMUNITY INFORMATION ~

summary:
**BCRTA (Butler County Regional Transit Authority) is hosting a free community event** on October 6th at 5pm. The evening includes:
- An info session at Oxford Seniors to learn about BCRTA services
- A free roundtrip bus ride uptown
- An intergenerational dinner at Fiesta Charra (participants pay for their own meals)
- Opportunity to connect with community members

The event is free, but attendees are responsible for their own meal costs.

title: Tuesday/Thursday Help Sessions for Missing Assignments
source_title: Back in the Swing of Things! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
~ 

Classroom 

News 

~

~ Classroom News ~

summary: Students who miss assignments during the week will receive a **green slip on Friday** listing outstanding work. They will be **automatically scheduled for after-school help sessions** the following Tuesday or Thursday to complete the work. Parents will receive an email notification. Students can either complete the work before the session or attend to get teacher help.
